comments:
I tried to get EMF from the Eclipse update site ans chose to run in 
background. It failed due to a timeout. A message was logged but there was no 
error prompt. It appears that update job logged the error and then returned OK 
from the job. The job should return an error status that contains the error. 
This will result in the user being prompted with an error dialog.

Here's the failure from the log.

!SESSION 2004-12-17 11:44:26.303 ----------------------------------------------
-

java.version=1.4.2_04
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=en_US
Command-line arguments:  -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86 -consolelog -debug -
clean

!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.runtime 8 1 2004-12-17 11:44:26.333
!MESSAGE

Tracing back to error log dump, it looks like error handling is done ok. There 
is one place in which the error constructed is making a call that could result 
in an NPE. I wonder if the NPE is silently eaten by the job processing.
I released a fix for avoiding the NPE, but I could not reproduce the original 
problem, so I can't claim the bug is fixed. I will leave it open for the time 
being, and will close it later if this goes away.
Michael, can you still see this problem in 3.2?
Seems that this problem was resolved by now.
